alert.note: Alert for Carlton (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 7:50PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... St. Louis River at Scanlon affecting Carlton County. .Snowmelt runoff has driven the St. Louis river into flood stage. Flooding continues across the area and is expected to continue. Cooler temperatures have slowed snow melt allowing slow recessions on the St. Louis River at Scanlon. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and is forecast. * WHERE...St. Louis River at Scanlon. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Minor flooding occurs of low areas adjacent to the river near Cloquet city park and near Scanlon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM CDT Thursday was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue to gradually fall from moderate flood stage and into minor flood stage by late Saturday. The river may then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun St. Louis River Scanlon 10.5 11.9 Thu 7 pm CDT 11.5 11.0 10.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon by 500 PM CDT.
